column4: Im having problems installing ubuntu in a netbook, I have a bangho netbook B-NOX1, and Im trying to install ubuntu via USB pendrive, the bios says it can boot from USB HDD, but It doesnt detect the usb drive, Ive tried booting from the pendrive with other machine and it works perfect, Im wondering if could be a pendrive size issue, its 8gb... should I try with a smaller one?
Is it set to boot the pendrive automatically? Or do you have to press esc or whatever, to go into a boot menu?
ive tried both ways and it didnt work out
that's weird, are you sure the pendrive is bootable?
yes, i can boot it in my notebook
Okay, so it's definately a problem with the bios on your netbook, does pressing escape during boot up present you with a boot menu?
yeah i mean i can go into the menus and select all usb entries and none of them will work
I don't know what to tell you man, what happens when you boot from the pendrive?
im my notebook its boots perfectly, and so in other computers, but the issue is with the the netbook, but i dont know if its somehitng about size of pendrive and bios compability...
It really shouldn't be that, netbooks are very recent creatures, I'm sure any bios will handle an 8gb stick
mmm i havent tried with another pendrive... it could be the pendrive too... ive seen some guys having similar problems on the web
Does the pendrive actually come up in the boot menu?
I'm not talking about going into the bios, I'm talking about a little menu that pops up, and gives you a choice of bootable media found
yes, but it doesnt detect the pendrive i can only see the sata driev
have you got another pendrive you can try?
an mp3 player but im worried i might have the mp3 player software if i format it
yeah, I wouldn't advise using that
